review_blob: On tap. Pours a slightly hazy hold with full head. Aromas of tropical fruit, mangos and spruce. Flavors follow same with additional line an emphasis on bitter spruce. Cant see what the fuss is about.

375 ml bottle. Pours a clear dark brown with moderate head. Aromas of dry brown sugar, light bourbon, and dry roasted malts. Flavors of same with a dry spiciness and grassiness, and without any sweetness. Dry almost dusty.
on tap. Pours black with with light head, Aromas of black coffee and sweet roasted malts. Flavors of sweetened coffee, cola, and sweet roasted malts. Pretty simple Scotch Ale but pleasant.

375 ml bottle. Pours a dark clear brown with moderate head. Aromas of caramel and brown sugar, sweet toasted malts, and light spice. Flavors of burnt marshmallow, toast. sweet malts, and wood with a slight ABV burn. Very nice.
On tap. Pours black with full foamy tan head. Aromas of watery milk chocolate. Flavors of mild vanilla and milk chocolate with a bit of roasted malts. Novelty.

On tap. Pours a clear copper with light head. Aromas of light but spicy brett.
Flavors of a dull watery but malty brett ale. Disappointing.

On tap. Pours a slightly hazy Amber with moderate head. Aromas of pineapple and candied fruit. Flavors of same with sharp wheat, resin and an unfortunate bit of  industrial cleaner. Get rid of the later and this would be a great summer beer. Must be a different batch tgan previous raters.
beer_name: Trading Post Owyhee Tropical Wheat Ale

review_blob: 650 ml bottle. Pours black with full head. Aromas of milk chocolate, vanilla, and marshmallow - as advertised. Flavors of same with additional sweet malts and graham cracker. Like a sweet mocha. Lighter than expected. A fun stout.

659 ml bottle. Pours a deep copper color with full head of big bubbles that dissipates quickly. Aromas of dried apricots, oak, and sweet malts. Flavors of apricot skins, green oak and canoed fruit. Almost chewy but with a good dose of carbonation - a really nice barrelled apricot beverage (beer?) I would buy again.
beer_name: Stave Lake Lost Barrel Series - Barrel Aged Apricot Ale

review_blob: 500 ml bottle. Pours black with full head that settles quickly. Aromas of balsamic vinegar, blackberries vanilla and oily roasted malts. Simply tastes as if herbal balsamic vinegar was mixed with a creamy stout. Why?
beer_name: Destihl Saint Dekkera Barrel Reserve Sour: Zure Dubbele Stout

review_blob: 12 oz bottle. Pours a garnet red/brown with moderate foamy head. Aromas of mashed pineapple, limes, rubber, and caramel malts. Flavors of red jelly, rubbery pine, and dough with a slight metallic edge. Very tasty.

650 ml bottle. Pours a dark mahogany with moderate head. Aromas of dark sweet fruit, dried strawberries, spicy oak and toasted malts. Flavors of dry red berries, grassy hops, oak, and sweet malts with a light bitter finish. Really tasty. Very nice.

650 ml bottle. Pours dark brown with moderate head. Aromas of boozy brown sugar, cognac and wet caramel malts. Flavors much the same with additional aged oak and tobacco. Harsh and boozy. Needs to sit for awhile.
beer_name: Evil Twin / Westbrook The Perfect Nose

review_blob: 2015 Vintage. 650 ml bottle. Pours black with moderate brown/tan head. Aromas of acidic fresh ground coffee, green oak, whiskey, roasted malts and raw alcohol. Flavors of dry black coffee, vanilla, light scotch, toasted oak, and dark bitter chocolate. Still a bit of an ABV edge but otherwise excellent.
beer_name: FiftyFifty Imperial Eclipse Stout - Coffee / Java Coffee

review_blob: 650 ml bottle. Pours a light hazy amber with light head. Aromas of coriander. limes, and wheat. Flavors are same with roasted pepper and throat burn. A nice twist to a wit. This one works for some reason...
beer_name: Ballast Point Wahoo White - Thai Chili

review_blob: 330 ml bottle. Pours black with a moderate foamy tan head. Aromas of milk chocolate, vanilla, Roasted malts and a little alcohol. Flavors of same with emphasis on dry roasted malts plus a little black coffee and a lot more alcohol. Except for the noticeable ABV a really nice stout - rich though not sweet with all the essentials.
12 oz bottle. Pours a dark amber/copper color with moderate head. Aromas of dried fruit and sweet bready malts. Flavor so muddled fruit like a dark marmalade with a metallic spiciness. OK

341 ml bottle. Pours a clear light gold with moderate head. Aromas of grapes, gooseberries, wheat, and winegums. Flavors of sour gummies, mixed tart fruit, and clean but muted wheat. Quite tart. Tasty - I could drink a lot of this.
beer_name: Parallel 49 / Four Winds Boys Are Back in Town (Nectarface)

review_blob: 12 oz bottle. Pours a deep copper color with light head. Aromas of candy, resin and toothpaste. Flavors of Belgian yeast, mint, cloves, rye and dry malts. Odd
beer_name: Dogfish Head Beer To Drink Music To

review_blob: 12 oz bottle. Pours a clear gold with light head. Light aromas of toasted malts and burnt metal. Light flavors of a fruity golden ale with a bit of Belgian yeast and very light pepper. Not offensive but so light I question the intent. Certainly not sour.

12 oz bottle. Pours a dark reddish brown with a light head that dissipates quickly. Aromas of caramel malts and cognac. Flavors of brown sugar, sweetened raisins, stick sweet malts, and alcohol. Very warming. Nice enough for a beer that carries a wallop three times its size.
On tap. Pour a very dark brown with moderate retentive head. Aromas of fruit gummies and wet malts. Flavors follow same with a little pineapple and pine. Pleasant.
beer_name: Parallel 49 / Hearthstone Sympathy for the Devil

review_blob: On tap. Pours a rd mahogany with light head. Aromas of sweet malts and dark fruit syrup. Flavors of same with additional brown sugar and a little sharp rye. Nice.
On tap. Pours a darkish amber with moderate head. Light earthy cotton candy aromas. Very weak watery farmhouse ale flavors. Not up to par.
On tap. Pours a clear gold with moderate head. Aromas of earth and dried bananas. Flavors of dry Belgian yeast, minerals, and more dry bananas. On style but boring.
beer_name: Parallel 49 / Barkerville Run to the Hills

review_blob: 330 ml bottle. Pours an almost opaque Brian with light head. Aromas of dark sugar and nutty brownies. Flavors of acidic nuts, phenols, bread crusts, and wet dark malts. Light lingering bitter finish. Much different than others - maybe off?
beer_name: Brouwerij Kees Wee Heavy Scotch Ale

beer_brewer_name: Melvin Brewing Company (Thai Me Up Restaurant & Brewery)
review_blob: On tap. Pour anber with moderate head. Aromas of pineapple, candied fruit, and toasted malts. Flavors follow same - sucky and fruity - with addition notes of dough, pine, and sweet malts. Wonderful.

On tap
Pours black with short tan head
Aromas of licorice and black coffee
Flavors of rich dry black coffee, bitter dark chocolate, dry roasted malts and possible some roasted pepper. A little retentive heat. Really nice
beer_name: Evil Twin An Ms Chili Jess

review_blob: On tap. Pours a dark clear brown with moderate foamy head. Aromas of bready malts. Flavors of wet barley malts, toast, salted nuts and light freshly ground coffee. Ok
beer_name: Howe Sound Mexican Chiapas Cold Pressed Coffee Ale

review_blob: On tap. Pours a clear dark gold with light head. Aromas of grassy hops and bread crusts. Flavors of soapy fruit, grain light pine and toasted malts. Just a money grab. There are so many better...

On tap. Pours black with light white head. Aromas of black coffee and roasted malts. Flavors of dry dark chocolate, acidic black coffee, bitter nuts and dry roasted malts. Dry bitter finish. Good for a dry stout but not an Imperial IMHO.
On tap. Pours a clean red mahogany with moderate head. Aromas of dry toasted malts and light pine/citrus. Flavors of limes, grapes, toasted malts and acidic bitter pine. A bit chaotic without intent.
On tap. Pours a cloudy brown with moderate head. Aromas of spice and dark grains. Flavours of allspice, rye, and bitter cooked vegetables. Nothing notable.
500 ml bottle. Pours dark brown with moderate head. Aromas of nuts, salted chocolate and roasted malts. Flavors of same. A little vegetal but OK.
330 ml can. Pours a dark straw color with full head that settles quickly. Huge mango and melon aroma with rice and grain. Flat flavors of overripe sweetened cantaloupe and cardboard. Oof.

500 ml bottle. Pours a right clear gold with little head. Aromas of funky pears and grain. Light flavors of apples, watery citrus and grain. Good for a hot day but not Four Winds caliber. And way too expensive for what it is.
beer_name: Four Winds / Le Trou du Diable Exil dEden

review_blob: 650 ml bottle. 2015 vintage. Pours black/brown with moderate tan head. Aromas of grain alcohols, dark milk chocolate, and light roasted malts. Flavors of chocolate liquor, light coconut, light whiskey barrel and dried roasted malts.Really nice harmony.
beer_name: FiftyFifty Imperial Eclipse Stout - High West Rye Barrel

review_blob: 12 oz bottle. Pours a dark brown with moderate head that settles quickly. Aromas of bready chocolate cake and toasted coconut. Flavors of same though floury with metallic and light vanilla notes. A very different brown but pleasant enough.

On tap. Pours black with moderate creamy tan head. Aromas of dry coffe beans and roasted malts. Flavors of rich freshly ground coffee, bitter dark chocolate, and smooth roasted malts. Really nice for a coffee stout - rich without being acidic. Right on.
beer_name: Trading Post Three Bears Breakfast Stout

review_blob: 650 ml bottle. Pours a dark gold with full head. Aromas of spicy dry orange peel and toasted malts. Flavors of dried toasted malts, grassy resin, and bitter lemon. Not one of the best of the series.
beer_name: Persephone Single Hop Series Apollo Pale Ale

review_blob: 650 ml bottle. Pours a hazy copper with very light head. Aromas of wine gums and jammy tropical fruit. Flavors of bitter orange marmalade, more wine gums, dried stoned fruit and dry pine. A bit of a jumble but interesting, and tasty in a fruity way.
650 ml bottle. Pours a dark bold with full head. Aromas of dill, herbs, and lemon. Flavors of same with a little toasted malts. Pithy. Sorachi come out front and center - overly so. OK.
beer_name: Persephone Single Hop Series Sorachi Ace Pale Ale

review_blob:
On tap. Pours hazy amber with light head
Aromas of grapefruit, fruit jelly and sweet malts
Flavors of bready malts, spicy citrus, pineapple and light pine. Fruity with a good bit of ABV dryness.
beer_name: Big Rock Urban Off the Richter

review_blob: 650 ml bottle. Pours black with a short tan head of big bubbles that dissipate quickly. Aromas of plasticy chocolate syrup. Light flavors of chocolate, milked espresso and oily roasted malts.
beer_name: Dead Frog Udder Domination Imperial Milk Stout

review_blob:
"Kermode".
On tap. Pours a hazy amber with light head. Aromas of sweet malts, tropical fruit and light pine. Flavors of candied fruit, pine and bready malts with a little pepper. Quite nice.
On tap. Pours a slightly hazy gold with moderate head. Aromas of coriander, lemon soap and wheat. Flavors same. Lean but refreshing.
beer_name: Le Trou du Diable Blanche de Shawi

review_blob:
From January. On tap
Pours a clear copper with moderate head
Aromas of light candied fruit and grain
Flavors of malts and copper. Crisp but thin

650 ml bottle. Pours a pinkish copper color with almost no head. Aromas of cherry cotton candy and metallic Belgian yeast. Flavors of woody, dry cotton candy, and earthly Belgian yeast. Sticky. OK but cant see what the fuss is about. Way over priced.
beer_name: Epic Brainless on Cherries (Batch 5 and higher, Red Wine Barrel)

review_blob: 650 ml bottle. Pours a clear dark gold with light to moderate white head. Aromas of woody resin and muted somewhat jammy pineapple. Flavors of pine, biscuit and jammy tropical fruit leaning toward citrus. Very nice.
beer_name: Persephone Single Hop Series 07270 Pale Ale

review_blob: 650 ml bottle. Pours a clear dark gold with moderate white head. Aromas of forest floor, pineapple, and light toasted malts. Flavors of burnt pine, resin, bitter citrus and dried toasted malts. Refreshing...
beer_name: Persephone Single Hop Series Chinook Pale Ale
